perturbation.original_text: All material submitted to Distributor will be provided by Distributor to S2K with comments or approval no later than three business days after receipt in AdLit.
perturbation.changed_text: All material submitted to Distributor will be provided by Distributor to S2K with comments or approval no later than ten business days after receipt in AdLit.
perturbation.explanation: This change extends the review period for marketing materials to ten business days. FINRA Rule 2210(c)(1)(B) requires that firms establish and implement policies and procedures for the review and approval of communications with the public. Delaying the review process beyond a reasonable timeframe could be construed as a failure to diligently supervise marketing materials, potentially violating FINRA regulations. The original timeline of 3 days can be considered within an adequate timeline while 10 business days is not.

perturbation.original_text:
If S2K wishes Distributor to perform an expedited review of marketing pieces within one business day of Distributor' receipt of such marketing pieces, the expedited review will be performed subject to and in accordance with the following:
a) A charge of $250 will apply to each request for expedited review, in addition to FINRA filing fees.
perturbation.changed_text:
If S2K wishes Distributor to perform an expedited review of marketing pieces within one business day of Distributor' receipt of such marketing pieces, the expedited review will be performed subject to and in accordance with the following:
a) A charge of $2500 will apply to each request for expedited review, in addition to FINRA filing fees.
perturbation.explanation: Increasing the expedited review fee to $2500 could be considered excessive and potentially violate FINRA's rules regarding fair and reasonable charges for services. While firms can charge for expedited reviews, the fees must be justifiable and not create a barrier to compliance. An unreasonably high fee could deter firms from seeking timely review, increasing the risk of non-compliant marketing materials.
perturbation.contradicted_law: FINRA Rules regarding fair and reasonable charges for services

perturbation.original_text: The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall end on the 60th day following a written notice from one party to the other of its decision to terminate this Agreement at the end of such 60-day period or upon termination of the applicable Distribution Agreement with respect to a Fund.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall end immediately following a written notice from one party to the other of its decision to terminate this Agreement or upon termination of the applicable Distribution Agreement with respect to a Fund.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the 60-day notice period for termination, allowing for immediate termination upon written notice. This could violate principles of contract law that require reasonable notice for termination, especially if it causes significant harm to one party. Furthermore, it could potentially conflict with SEC or FINRA regulations that mandate reasonable steps to ensure a smooth transition of responsibilities when terminating agreements that impact investor protection.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding reasonable notice; SEC/FINRA regulations regarding orderly transitions
